title.narrative: Center for Kirkeligt Udviklingssamarbejde (CKU) - 'Renoverings -og forsendelsesordningen' - Pool grants since 2019

description.narrative: Poll grant administered by Center for Kirkeligt Udviklingssamarbejde (CKU). Pool of grants for repair of used equipment and distribution for global South. The objective of the grant is to strengthen civil society organisations in the South and to increase public anchorage.

The Recycling for Development (RfD) modality managed by The Center for Church-Based Development (CKU) supports donation of used and recycled equipment and other materials to developing countries. RfD works toward four goals, namely fighting poverty; creating sustainable development through meaningful inclusion of local partners; supporting civil society through donations that contribute to local communities at large; popular anchorage by facilitating small Danish associations' contribution to development work and as a support modality that can engage groups who may not otherwise be participating in such efforts.
Due to its nature as a pooled fund operational results are general and aggregated. The MFA contribution is thus reflected in the overall results reporting by the partner. For more information on the RfD modality please refer to the hyperlink below.
More information on the project here: https://www.genbrugtilsyd.dk/
